intro: Thelesperma hybridum, commonly known as the plains coreopsis, is a flowering plant native to the central and southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow to orange daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky soils. It has hairy, gray-green leaves and produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Thelesperma hybridum is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
